channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16945] Implement AsyncRegionLocator
item.description: Will implement it based on the small scan introduced in HBASE-16932 and the async zk cluster registry introduced in HBASE-16835.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

stack Yu Li Any concerns on the patch? This could make the request of AsyncTable fully asynchronous.

The patch looks great.

There is little logging though on how region locator is working. I'd think a bunch of trace level logging w/ detail on what it is doing would be good to have while it is new,. We'll want to study how it is running out in the wild and to get detail on why it is stuck on a cycle or continually returning a stale value.

Otherwise, it is looking real nice.

Yeah the whole async client implementation lacks of trace log and metrics...

Let me file a issue later to address it. Maybe we could add trace log for every asynchronous operation. For example, before scheduling, log "start XXX", and when the callback is invoked, log "end XXX".

I think this will help debugging this stuff while it is new. There will be teething issues. Even later when a strange corner case.... A follow on dedicated to offering more insight on its operation sounds good to me.
Add testcase for meta region moving. Add trace and debug log for AsyncRegionLocator.

-1 overall

stack What do you think of the new patch? I have added some logs.

Thanks.
Sorry for being late to the party, great work, checking the v1 patch now

Some minor comments, other parts LGTM:

1. For the protected updateCachedLocation method of AsyncRegionLocator line 404, change to if (!canUpdate(newLoc, oldLoc))

2. Considering also abstract and form a removeFromCache method so we could directly invoke it from somewhere else if needed in the future? I mean line 428-441 of AsyncRegionLocator

1. For the protected updateCachedLocation method of AsyncRegionLocator line 404, change to if (!canUpdate(newLoc, oldLoc))

They are not same.
!(oldLoc != null && oldLoc.getSeqNum() <= loc.getSeqNum() && oldLoc.getServerName().equals(loc.getServerName()))
= oldLoc == null || oldLoc.getSeqNum() > loc.getSeqNum() || !oldLoc.getServerName().equals(loc.getServerName())

And for line 404, the condition is
oldLoc != null && (oldLoc.getSeqNum() > newLoc.getSeqNum() || oldLoc.getServerName().equals(newLoc.getServerName()))
Extract a removeFromCache method.

-1 overall

They are not same...

Aye, different logic indeed.

Patch v2 LGTM, +1. Thanks.

I think it sweet that you no longer have to close down regionlocator.

getDefaultRegionLocation is a bad name for a region locating method (Not your patch – just saying) and it has no javadoc on what 'default' means in this case.

Otherwise, patch looks good to me (Is making me study-up on java8ism...)

getDefaultRegionLocation means get the location of the region with the default replica id 0. I haven't implement the timelined read logic for now. I think the logic will be completely different. So here I only cache the primary(default) replica in meta cache.
Will commit shortly if no objections.

Pushed to master.

Thanks stack and Yu Li for reviewing.

Is making me study-up on java8ism...

The same for me (Smile).

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-Trunk_matrix #1894 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1894/)
